body: I noticed changing column sort (e.g. `Last Updated`) fires off like a million Redux actions in the console. Is it possible to batch all the `[RECIPE|REVISION]_RECEIVED` actions? -- @mythmon Made a good point - we probably don't have to actually handle the actions differently (e.g. adding a `_BULK_RECEIVED` action)~, but rather change the redux logger to collapse multiple actions.~ (edit: we checked, turns out you can't do that with our redux logger) The reason this stood out to me as something to change was the fact that it takes ~2-3 seconds to sort when clicking. console.logging can definitely add to that, though I know @rehandalal and I had run into a Redux issue like this before where multiple actions would hang the browser. Worth investigating both options. -- Last thing - looks like an `undefined` action is being dispatched:
body_text:
I noticed changing column sort (e.g. Last Updated) fires off like a million Redux actions in the console. Is it possible to batch all the [RECIPE|REVISION]_RECEIVED actions?
--
@mythmon Made a good point - we probably don't have to actually handle the actions differently (e.g. adding a _BULK_RECEIVED action), but rather change the redux logger to collapse multiple actions. (edit: we checked, turns out you can't do that with our redux logger)
The reason this stood out to me as something to change was the fact that it takes ~2-3 seconds to sort when clicking. console.logging can definitely add to that, though I know @rehandalal and I had run into a Redux issue like this before where multiple actions would hang the browser. Worth investigating both options.
--
Last thing - looks like an undefined action is being dispatched:
